{"blocks":[{"key":"ck0vc","text":"Laboratory work space and equipment were sterilized by UV-light and DNase solution and 70% ethanol. Filter pipet tips were used in all steps of the laboratory work.

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1r8bt","text":"DNA extraction can be performed using Qiagen DNeasy power water sterivex kit. The quality of the extracted DNA was estimated using Nanodrop. \n\nQiagen DNeasy power water sterivex kit: https://www.qiagen.com/se/resources/resourcedetail?id=c5fe7d5f-070a-4ebe-ac04-4bbf05a13e91\u0026lang=en","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":183,"length":98}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"581EF59E44694B5C8484B755521ADD11","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/se/resources/resourcedetail?id=c5fe7d5f-070a-4ebe-ac04-4bbf05a13e91\u0026lang=en"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oo5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"55cn4","text":"Perform the first PCR (triplicates/duplicates of each sample) using Illumina adaptor attached primers that target the gene of your choice. 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6vpe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m43g","text":"MiFish primers ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54npv","text":"A modified version of the universal primers targeting the hypervariable region of the 12S rRNA gene (163-185 bp)  (Miya et al., 2015) was used. The sequence of the primer set is ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u187","text":"MiFish-UF: 5'ACA CTC TTT CCC TAC ACG ACG CTC TTC CGA TCT NNN NNN GTC GGT AAA ACT CGT GCC AGC ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mubs","text":"MiFish-UmR: 5'AGA CGT GTG CTC TTC CGA TCT NNN NNN CAT AGT GGG GTA TCT AAT CCC AGT TTG.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmaqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f75r5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

  Reaction Buffer","5X","1X","5"],["MiFish_F","10 µM","0,3 µM","0,75"],["MiFish_R","10 µM","0,3 µM","0,75"],["dNTPs"," 2 mM","0,2 mM","2,5"],["Q5 HF

{"blocks":[{"key":"crf1u","text":"Check PCR products with Agarose gel electrophoresis (1%) - optional 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7ddd","text":"Pool PCR duplicate samples together and perform purification with magnetic beads (Agencourt AMPure or similar)



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rkr4","text":"A second PCR is conducted for attaching standard illumina handles and index primers ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"418gc","text":"Multiplex_fwd","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ofpj","text":" AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGA{TCTACAC}-[i5 index] ACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACG ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"49apa","text":"Multiplex_rev ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bke72","text":"CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGAT-[i7 index]-GTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGATCT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b7vik","text":"We have in total 20 different forward index/barcode primers and 20 different reverse index/barcode primers. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9dte7","text":"By combining both primers (20X20), it is possible to generate 400 tags in one final pool for sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76ka5","text":"Check second PCR products with Agarose gel electrophoresis (1%) 




","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6csiu","text":"Quantification of the concentration of second PCR product before pooling using PicoGreen assay","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"amhjd","text":"http://tools.thermofisher.com/content/sfs/manuals/PicoGreen-dsDNA-protocol.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":78}],"data":[]},{"key":"4h1r6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqcqo","text":"Calculate PCR samples concentration and volume before pooling 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B957469EC24B44D9B3107A9CD9EDB5E7","url":"http://tools.thermofisher.com/content/sfs/manuals/PicoGreen-dsDNA-protocol.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oodi","text":"Pool the PCR samples in equal DNA amount (ng) or for unequal length amplicons, in equal molecule amount (mol). You will get one tube including a mix of all the samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7hp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ge6a","text":"To calculate the volume of each sample to be pooled (DNA amount mixing):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5uht9","text":"- Use the lowest concentration sample to define the minimum amount of DNA (ng) that you have available from a single sample: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7vb7e","text":"DNA concentration (ng/μL) of the lowest concentration sample multiplied with its volume (μL). This will be your target DNA amount for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"db4sv","text":"- Calculate how many μLs of each sample you need to achieve the target DNA amount: divide the target DNA amount with the concentration of each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4st51","text":"- Pipette into one tube the calculated volume of each sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d5acc","text":"Aim to use the same pipette for all samples (dilute or pipette multiple times) to avoid pipette calibration errors. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5rtc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"diqtg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64dck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40npi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpfe9","text":"Gel purify the pool and requantify with PicoGreen before submitting to sequencing facility. 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhd0s","text":"Sequencing was performed illumina paired end sequence strategy (150 bp). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2u15f","text":"Analysis was carried out by DADA2 pipeline https://benjjneb.github.io/dada2/tutorial.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":46}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2FA57CB014C64C17988EAC90D67E5B1E","url":"https://benjjneb.github.io/dada2/tutorial.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4flke","text":"Mock community","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej9b6","text":"DNA extract of 10 fish species were pooled and used as a positive control ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67igi","text":"-The fish species are Clupea harengus, Glypthocephalus cynoglossus, Scomber scombus, Thunnus alalunga, Pleuroneates platessa, Pollachius virens, Salmo salar, Gadus morhua, Reinhardtius hippoglossoides and Melanogrammus aeglefinus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":207}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ovqk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cunc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Environmental DNA (eDNA) metabarcoding protocol for fish species
title_html: Environmental DNA (eDNA) metabarcoding protocol for fish species

versions.title: Environmental DNA (eDNA) metabarcoding protocol for fish species
versions.title_html: Environmental DNA (eDNA) metabarcoding protocol for fish species

warning:
{"blocks":[{"key":"94dhc","text":"The 1st part of the protocol is performed in the pre-PCR room.
 The 2nd part in the post-PCR room. 
Never bring back PCR products to the pre-PCR room. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6r1ur","text":"Always add a negative control samples in each PCR run



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
